text: originally posted in the hubl channel but I think it’s more appropriate here … Banging my head agains the wall on this.  Trying to grab the id of a multilanguage version of a blog but can’t seem to access it.  Here’s my variable: `{% set test = blog_by_id('111111111').translations.items() %}` which returns this: [es=2222222222, language: es, masterId: 1111111111] … so I think i’d be able to access the id like this: `{{ blog_by_id('11111111').<http://translations.es|translations.es> }}` but it returns nothing.

following up on this <@UGY22E2KC> --- the resulting array seems to be a PyMap which has the translated Blog ID showing, but it doesn't seem to be accessible by the standard dot syntax ( ^^ what <@U0189NXRP1U> shows above with the `blog_by_id().<http://translations.es|translations.es>` )

The pretty print returns as such: `(PyMap: {es=2222222222, language: es, masterId: 11111111111})` -- I would think that dot syntax would allow for us to access this fairly simply? Is this not the case?
